snippet: Israel would not confirm that it had carried out the airstrikes, but the four explosions near the Syrian capital demonstrated a firepower more potent than any seen before in the country’s civil war.
abstract: Syrian government publicly condemns Israel for powerful air assault on military targets near Damascus; attack and Syrian response raise fears that country's civil war could expand beyond its borders.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria, Hala Droubi from Dubai, Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran, Ben Hubbard from Cairo, Michael Schwirtz from New York and Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Israel would not confirm that it had carried out the airstrikes, but the four explosions near the Syrian capital demonstrated a firepower more potent than any seen before in the country’s civil war.

headline.seo: Syria Condemns Israel for Air Assault Near Damascus
headline.main: Syria Blames Israel for Fiery Attack in Damascus
headline.print_headline: Syria Condemns Israeli Assault Near Damascus
